result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon R Edwards

records.addlTxt: copy of discovery material filed by Atty Ross to Atty Riek
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Jonathan Ross
Copy of discovery letter to Attorney Amanda Riek from ADA Jonathan Ross
Court converted to a $1,000.00 signature bond, cash bond to be returned to poster. Same conditions originally ordered remain
Deferred Prosecution Contract filed by counsel

10:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marlon R Edwards appeared in court, Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared in court for Marlon R Edwards. Court reviewed right to preliminary hearing, defendant waived. Court found probable cause, bound over. Waived readings of Information/Complaint. Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Court found defendant guilty. Judgement to be entered. Court withheld adjudication and placed defendant on a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for 30 months. Atty Riek addressed posted cash bond; request to be returned to poster. State did not object. Court will convert to a $1,000.00 signature, same conditions; cash bond to be returned to poster. 22 TR 41 dismissed. 10:52 AM
